content: There's plenty of open tasks like this: GF#17614. It seems to me that it's not worth spending the time to process them now. Any opinions?
It makes sense to hold on to them for use during the QA period at least
Hard to ask people to do QA if we don't (eventually) take advantage of their work...
we mostly do, and we did apply many of those changes, but not all of them.
but I don't see the point of 'holding onto them'. I'm not even sure what it means...
It means that if we don't have a chance to apply them before the QA period, we can at least look at applying them during the QA period
I believe that you are arguing that we should not delete the tasks from gForge
ok let's kick them to R5 then
I was saying don't kick them to R5. It's QA against R4, so we ought to apply it if we can.
well, ok... but the problem is, many things have been fixed. many have been orphaned. We're probably talking about a 20% yield. I do not believe that we have time
R3/R4 conversions are way more important and that's a real problem for me now
Agree that this isn't a good use of your time. Perhaps we can find someone else who can go through these.
I'll get Anne to put it on the FMG agenda
